content: The "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" establishes a Center of Excellence for the prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation of health conditions related to exposure to burn pits and other environmental exposures. The "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" establishes a Center of Excellence within the Department of Veterans Affairs for addressing health conditions related to exposure to burn pits and environmental exposures. The Secretary will establish the center using existing department directives, recommendations from oversight bodies, and guidance from the Secretary of Defense. The Secretary shall select a site for the Center of Excellence based on entities with specialized equipment for studying health conditions from burn pits exposure, a history of publishing post-deployment health information for veterans, access to models of dust immunology and lung injury related to Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The Center of Excellence for health conditions related to burn pits exposure will collaborate with the Department of Defense and other entities to develop best practices for treatment and provide guidance on personnel requirements for quality healthcare for veterans and Armed Forces members. The Center of Excellence for health conditions related to burn pits exposure aims to train health professionals, oversee treatment programs, advance research on exposure effects, disseminate best practices, and conduct research on the etiology and prevention of related health conditions. The Center of Excellence for health conditions related to burn pits exposure aims to provide medical treatment to veterans diagnosed with conditions specific to exposure to burn pits and other environmental exposures. The center will have access to data from the burn pits registry to carry out its responsibilities. The Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act authorizes funding for research on environmental exposures in Afghanistan and Iraq. $4,100,000 is allocated for the first five fiscal years, with additional funding available for research purposes.
